itemDescription: British barrister and Liberal Party politician (1887-1967)

wikipedia_page.main: Sydney Cope Morgan MBE QC (25 October 1887 – 14 October 1967), was a British barrister and Liberal Party politician.

response: Of the two unsuccessful candidates, Hugh Dalton was a Cambridge-educated LSE lecturer in economics who went on to be an MP from 1924, and became Labour's Chancellor under Clement Attlee; and Sydney Cope Morgan was a Cambridge-educated barrister who went on to contest the seat again for the Liberals with an increased vote at each of the next two general elections.
* Sydney Cope Morgan (1887–1967), British barrister and politician
The Liberal candidate, Sydney Cope Morgan had not contested the last election.
